intro: Lactuca cichorioides, commonly known as the bitterleaf lettuce, is a flowering plant in the dandelion family (Asteraceae). It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open areas. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and have a distinctive bitter taste. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, followed by small, spiky fruits. Lactuca cichorioides is often considered a weed but can be used in some traditional herbal remedies.
